About Me

Let me tell you few things about myself.

BIO

I was born at 1985 in small town Anykščiai. I had a very amazing childhood before technologies conquered the world. All the summers I have spent at my grandmother in the village, where my uncle taught me to drive all motor vehicles. At the age of 15, I got my first PC and it was the beginning of my interest in computer science. I was entirely interested in how the things work there, behind the screen.

Despite my curiosity in IT, after graduation in high school, I decided to study telecommunication engineering leaving coding aside.

After my studies, the market was hit by a 2008 world economic crisis. Then I moved to Norway and spent there 7 years.

I came back to Lithuania in 2015, tried different jobs, I even established my own company, but I felt that something was not right. I quit, I took a break. Then accidentally I read an inspirational story about a girl who learnt how to code. I liked that story so much, that now I‘m going back to my roots.

Why?

Coding

Each day technologies develop more and more. I had an interest in it when I was a kid and now I am even hungrier for the knowledge how it works.

How iPhone is more powerful than Apollo 11 space rocket. How SpaceX rocket’s going up and landing down. It is a huge part of brilliant programming. And I want to be part of developer society.

Learning

Front end developer

Where to start learning to code? There are so many options, it was very hard to choose, but at Vilnius Coding school I got help. They recommended to begin with Frond End. There I got it more than I expected in HTML5, CSS, JAVASCRIPT, PHP and etc. Now, every day I try to learn something new.

Future

QA specialist

Before I began learning Front End, I knew that I want to be a QA specialist. Though I like what I’m doing now, I want to search for bugs in software and help others fix that. My plan is to be automated QA specialist, but before that, I want to learn manual testing. In my opinion, that’s best way to learn.
